definition: (classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)

sentences.english: Today, the only remaining trackers pulled tourists upstream.
sentences.chinese: 如今硕果仅存的纤夫将游客拉到上游。

sentences.english: Hitched to lines made of bamboo, straining with bent backs, their fingers almost touched the ground.
sentences.chinese: 纤夫扯着竹绳弯腰使劲，手指几乎触地。

sentences.english: In early 2010, it is controversial for its recovery of "naked trackers".
sentences.chinese: 2010年初，这里因为恢复“裸体纤夫”饱受争议。

sentences.english: They pull on the river left a string of footprints, it was wayfarers ellipsis of life.
sentences.chinese: 纤夫在河边留下一串脚印，那是跋涉者生活的省略号。

sentences.english: Contemporary boat tracker, it has much to love?
sentences.chinese: 当代纤夫，那能有几多爱？

sentences.english: The towers are dragging a ship.
Towing harnesses slip off easily should the current drag pullers backward.
sentences.chinese: 由于拉纤容易滑倒，而今的纤夫必须避免。

definition: to scull (with a single oar, usually mounted on the stern of the boat)
person who lives and makes a living on a boat/boatman/boat dweller
